title: Change name of first argument in get_weights_by_return() and get_weights_by_time_decay() for clarity
body:
I suggest changing the name of the first argument of ```get_weights_by_return()``` and ```get_weights_by_time_decay()``` from this:

```
get_weights_by_return(triple_barrier_events, close_series, num_threads=5)
get_weights_by_time_decay(triple_barrier_events, close_series, num_threads=5, decay=1)
```

to this:

```
get_weights_by_return(events, close_series, num_threads=5)  
get_weights_by_time_decay(events, close_series, num_threads=5, decay=1)
```
The reason is that this function also accepts events from the trend_scanning_labels function, so naming this with a more generic name will be less confusing for users.

By the same token, ```get_av_uniqueness_from_triple_barrier()``` could also be changed from:

```
get_av_uniqueness_from_triple_barrier(triple_barrier_events, close_series, num_threads)
```

to this:

``` 
get_av_uniqueness_from_events(events, close_series, num_threads)
```

I also have a more general reflexion on the whole events naming conventions to suggest, but I'll do this in a separate issue.

Thanks and I hope you find this useful!
